name: omi CrB
scenarioDescription:
The omi CrB Exoplanetary System


Overview

omi CrB is a star with 2.13 times the mass of the Sun, and 10.5 times its radius. It is located 277.20 light years away from the solar system.

omi CrB is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the omi CrB system


omi CrB b

omi CrB b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.83 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of omi CrB b is 477 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, omi CrB b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system omi CrB, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
